sections.content: Astronomy content captures wonder—planets, galaxies, meteor showers, and celestial events. Filming the night sky requires specialized gear, but modern cameras make astrophotography more accessible. Educational content about space also thrives. Here's what astronomy YouTubers use.

faq.question: Best camera for astrophotography?
faq.answer: Sony A7S III excellent for video. Canon or Nikon full-frame for stills. Dedicated astronomy cameras for deep sky. Even entry DSLRs can capture impressive images. Full frame helps but isn't required.

faq.question: Do I need a telescope?
faq.answer: Not for wide-field Milky Way shots—just camera and lens. Telescope for planets and deep sky objects. Star tracker for longer exposures without telescope. Start with camera, add telescope as you progress.

faq.question: How to find dark sky locations?
faq.answer: Light pollution maps (darksitefinder.com). National parks often have dark skies. Higher elevation typically darker. Check moon phase—avoid full moon. Travel time often required for quality skies.

faq.question: Best content for astronomy channel?
faq.answer: Celestial event coverage (eclipses, meteor showers) gets massive views. Educational explainers have lasting value. Processing tutorials help community. Gear reviews for beginners to experts.
